translated: The Questions of King Milinda
The Great Chapter
The Questions of Sīla and Lakkhaṇa
The King said:

original: “bhante nāgasena, yaṁ panetaṁ brūsi ‘aññehi ca kusalehi dhammehī’ti, katame te kusalā dhammā”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena yam pana itam brūsi aññehi ca kusalehi dhammehi iti katame te kusalāḥ dhammā ati
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say ‘and other good qualities’, what are these good qualities?”

original: “Sīlaṁ, mahārāja, saddhā vīriyaṁ sati samādhi, ime te kusalā dhammā”ti.
analyzed: sīla mahā rāja saddhā vīriyam sati samādhi ime te kusalā dhammā ati
translated: “Morality, faith, energy, mindfulness, concentration, these are the good qualities.”

original: “Kiṁlakkhaṇaṁ, bhante, sīlan”ti?🔽“Patiṭṭhānalakkhaṇaṁ, mahārāja, sīlaṁ sabbesaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ, indriyabalabojjhaṅgamaggaṅgasatipaṭṭhānasammappadhānaiddhipādajhānavimokkhasamādhisamāpattīnaṁ
analyzed: bhante  patiṭṭhāna lakkhaṇa mahā rāja sīlam sabbesam kusalānam dhammānaḥ indriya bala bojjhaṅga maggaṅga sati paṭṭhāna sammappadhāna eddhipāda jhāna vimokkha samādhi samāpattīnaṃ
translated: “What is the distinguishing mark of morality, revered sir?”🔽“Morality, sire, is the distinguishing mark of all good qualities, of the faculties, the powers, the factors of enlightenment, the factors of the path, the foundations of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of psychic power, the jhānas, the liberations, the concentrations, and the attainments.

original: sīlaṁ patiṭṭhaṁ, sīle patiṭṭhito kho, mahārāja, yogāvacaro sīlaṁ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya
analyzed: sīlam patiṭṭha sīle patiṭṭhitaḥ kho mahā rāja yogāvacaraḥ sīlam nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya
translated: Morality is the foundation, sire, and the one who is devoted to mental training, established in morality,

original: pañcindriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyaṁ vīriyindriyaṁ satindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ paññindriyanti,
analyzed: pañca indriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyam vīriyindriyam satindriyam samādhindriyam pañcindriyanti
translated: develops the five faculties: the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of wisdom.

analyzed: sabbe kusalāḥ dhammāḥ na parihāyanti iti
translated: All good qualities do not decline.”
“Make a simile.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, ye keci bījagāmabhūtagāmā vuḍḍhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjanti, sabbe te pathaviṁ nissāya pathaviyaṁ patiṭṭhāya vuḍḍhiṁ virūḷhiṁ vepullaṁ āpajjanti;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja ye keci bīja gāma bhūta gāmāḥ vuḍḍhim virūḍhim vepullam āpajjanti sabbe te pathavim nissāya pathaviyam patiṭṭhāya vuḍḍhim virūḍhim vepullam āpajjanti
translated: “As, sire, whatever seeds and plants grow and increase and come to fulfilment all do so by depending on the earth, by being established on the earth,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yogāvacaro sīlaṁ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañcindriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyaṁ vīriyindriyaṁ satindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ paññindriyan”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yogāvacaraḥ sīlam nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañca indriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyam vīriyindriyam satindriyam samādhindriyam paññindriyanti
translated: even so, sire, the devotee, depending on morality, established on morality, develops the five faculties, the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of wisdom.”
“Give a further illustration.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, ye keci balakaraṇīyā kammantā kayiranti, sabbe te pathaviṁ nissāya pathaviyaṁ patiṭṭhāya kayiranti;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja ye keci bala karaṇīyā kammantā kayiranti sabbe te pathavim nissāya pathaviyam patiṭṭhāya kayiranti
translated: “As, sire, whatever works that are done by those who are strong all are done by depending on the earth, by being established on the earth,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yogāvacaro sīlaṁ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañcindriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyaṁ vīriyindriyaṁ satindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ paññindriyan”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yogāvacaraḥ sīlam nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañca indriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyam vīriyindriyam satindriyam samādhindriyam paññindriyanti
translated: even so, sire, the devotee, depending on morality, established on morality, develops the five faculties, the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of wisdom.”
“Give a further illustration.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, nagaravaḍḍhakī nagaraṁ māpetukāmo paṭhamaṁ nagaraṭṭhānaṁ sodhāpetvā
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja nagara vaḍḍhakī nagaram mā a petu kāmaḥ paṭhamam nagara ṭṭhānam sodhāpetvā
translated: “As, sire, a town-planner, desiring to build a town, first of all clears the site of the town,

original: khāṇukaṇṭakaṁ apakaḍḍhāpetvā bhūmiṁ samaṁ kārāpetvā tato aparabhāge vīthicatukkasiṅghāṭakādiparicchedena
analyzed: khāṇu kaṇṭakam apakaḍḍhāpetvā bhūmim samam kārāpetvā tatas apara bhāge vīthi catukka siṅghāṭaka ādi paricchedena
translated: removes the stumps and thorns, makes the ground even, and then later on, having divided it up by streets, squares, parks and so on,
builds the town;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yogāvacaro sīlaṁ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañcindriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyaṁ vīriyindriyaṁ satindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ paññindriyan”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yogāvacaraḥ sīlam nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañca indriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyam vīriyindriyam satindriyam samādhindriyam paññindriyanti
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training, depending on virtue, established on virtue, develops the five faculties: the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of wisdom.”
“Please give another illustration.”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, laṅghako sippaṁ dassetukāmo pathaviṁ khaṇāpetvā sakkharakathalaṁ apakaḍḍhāpetvā bhūmiṁ samaṁ kārāpetvā mudukāya bhūmiyā sippaṁ dasseti;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja laṅghakaḥ sippam dassetu kāmaḥ pathavim khaṇāpetvā sakkharaka thalam apakaḍḍhāpetvā bhūmim samam kārāpetvā mudukāya bhūmiyā sippam dasseti
translated: “As, sire, a tightrope-walker, desiring to display his skill, has the ground dug up, removes the gravel and sand, makes the ground even, and displays his skill on the soft ground;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yogāvacaro sīlaṁ nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañcindriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyaṁ vīriyindriyaṁ satindriyaṁ samādhindriyaṁ paññindriyanti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yogāvacaraḥ sīlam nissāya sīle patiṭṭhāya pañca indriyāni bhāveti saddhindriyam vīriyindriyam satindriyam samādhindriyam paññindriyanti
translated: Even so, sire, the devotee, depending on virtue, established in virtue, develops the five faculties, the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, the faculty of wisdom.”
And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One:
“The wise man, established in virtue,
Developing his mind and wisdom,
The monk who is ardent and watchful,
He will disentangle this tangle.”
This is the foundation, as the earth is of creatures,
And this is the root of the growth of the good;

analyzed: mukham ca idam sabba jina anusāsane
translated: This is the beginning of the teaching of all the Conquerors,
This is the aggregate of virtue, the excellent Pāṭimokkha.”
“You are skilled, revered Nāgasena.”
The ninth discussion.
